son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

to show deference or praise publicly

definition: to do (sb) proud/to be a credit to (one's school etc)/to make oneself look good/to build up one's image
to contradict sb to his face/insensitive to other's feelings

sentences.english: It is better to weed out the bad businesses within the group rather than cross-subsidise them to save face.
sentences.chinese: 將集團內的不良業務剔除，好過爲了面子予以挽救。

sentences.english: Collect leave, younger sister of your Cheng Yi does not have face very much, step down a stage in anger.
sentences.chinese: 羅的離去，令程伊妹很沒面子，憤然走下臺去。

sentences.english: They take themselves seriously the appearance of other in part, with be concerned about face-saving about.
sentences.chinese: 他們重視自己另一半的相貌，與愛面子有關。

sentences.english: He felt he lost face when his teacher scolded him in front of the class.
sentences.chinese: 當老師當着全體同學的面批評他時他感到面子大丟。

sentences.english: What Chinese cannot bear most is to be refused or to lose face.
sentences.chinese: 中國人認爲最不能容忍的事情是受到拒絕和不給面子。

sentences.english: I give them face, I'm afraid them to cry.
sentences.chinese: 我給他們留了面子，我擔心他們會哭。

sentences.english: If there are these three major pcs, that miss gets married of time have high social standing.
sentences.chinese: 如果有了這三大件，那姑娘出嫁的時候是很有面子的。

sentences.english: Saving face is a fundamental value.
sentences.chinese: 給人留面子是基本要求。

sentences.english: He did much credit to his patrons.
sentences.chinese: 他爲他的恩人爭了很多面子。

sentences.english: W2: No, Chinese worry about losing face a lot more than people in my country.
sentences.chinese: 不，中國人比我們國家的人更愛面子。

sentences.english: Because Fang Qiong cheated money, face on Monday, a hunger strike at home.
sentences.chinese: 方瓊因爲被騙了錢，面子上下不來，在家絕食抗議。

sentences.english: Aries are very big concerns, is also very concerned about their views on others.
sentences.chinese: 牡羊座的人非常愛面子，也很在意別人對他們的看法。

sentences.english: When my guest comes, you put on a show with me.
sentences.chinese: 一會兒客人到了，你一定要給足我面子，明白嗎？

sentences.english: Put down the so-called man's face once in a while, but can make her injured heart warm.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾放下所謂男人的面子，卻能溫暖她受傷的心。

sentences.english: For one, I don't need a new phone. Except for some reception problems, my StarTac works fine.
sentences.chinese: 我不需要新手機，除了面子上的問題，我的摩托羅拉。

sentences.english: His parents' obsession with keeping up appearances haunted his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 父母過於愛面子的做法在他兒時一直困擾着他。
